title: GeoView Core Config Schema
comments: Configuration for GeoView core packages, each packages manages it own schema.

parser.description: A path to a javascript file with a function for parsing the layers identify output. Only needed if a custom template is being used.

template.description: A path to an html template that will override default identify output.

id.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service).

name.description: The display name of the layer. If it is not present the viewer will make an attempt to scrape this information.

url.description: The service endpoint of the layer. It should match the type provided in layerType.

tooltipField.description: The field to be used for tooltips.  If it is not present the viewer will use nameField (if provided).

id.description: The GeoCore catalog uuid of the layer.

url.description: The url path to the geoCore endpoint (optional, this value should be embeded in the GeoView).

interaction.description: If map is dynamic (pan/zoom) or static to act as a thumbnail.

projection.description: Spatial Reference EPSG code supported (https://epsg.io/). We support Web Mercator and Lambert Conical Conform Canada.

zoom.description: Initial map zoom level. Zoom level are define by the basemap zoom levels.

prefixItems.description: Initial latitude value for map center.
Initial longitude value for map center.

id.description: Id of the basemap to use.

shaded.description: Enable or disable shaded basemap (if basemap id is set to shaded then this should be false).

layers.description: Layer list in the order which they should be added to the map.

about.description: The content of the about section in Markdown format. If empty, it will be ignored. If not, it will create a button on the appbar to open the panel.

components.description: Core components to initialize on viewer load. The schema for those are inside this file.

corePackages.description: Core packages to initialize on viewer load. The schema for those are on their own package. NOTE: config from packages are in the same loaction as core config (<<core config name>>-<<package name>>.json).

name.description: External Package name. The name must be ideintical to the window external package object to load.

configUrl.description: The url to the external package configuration setting. The core package will read the configuration and pass it inside the package.

externalPackages.description: List of external packages to initialize on viewer load.

keys.description: Service end point to access API for layers specification (loading and plugins parameters). By default it is GeoCore but can be another endpoint with similar output.

language.description: ISO 639-1 code indicating the language of strings in the schema file.

version.description: The schema version used to validate the configuration file. The schema should enumerate the list of versions accepted by this version of the viewer.
